title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, June 21, 1864
summary: Nadenbousch sends a friend bearing a note to his wife. He hopes for an end to the war so he can see his family and "live in peace." He says that business at the Hotel has been slow due to destruction of the railroad. He also discusses financial matters, the possibility of his returning home with a pass, and mutual acquaintances.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
